page.title: 06Landscape Duncliffe Wood
page.content: Duncliffe Wood is a mixed wood of oak,hazel,ash and conifers,which stretches over twin hills like a saddle. It was valued in the original Domesday Book at Â£9 and bought by the Woodland Trust for Â£100,000,much of it raised by local people. We raised over Â£300 by collecting crisp packets,10p a job and collections. Duncliffe is a refuge for wild-life. Deer,foxes and badgers can be seen. Care should be taken as adders breed on the hill. The hill is open to the public. {PAGE 9}Bird Mammal & Tree list {PAGE 10}Flower list.
